data.title: Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Kerala/Archive 3
data.text:
Archive 1 Archive 2 Archive 3

Hello, all. It was initially my hope to try to have this done as part of Esperanza's proposal for an appreciation week to end on Wikipedia Day, January 15. However, several people have once again proposed the entirety of Esperanza for deletion, so that might not work. It was the intention of the Appreciation Week proposal to set aside a given time when the various individuals who have made significant, valuable contributions to the encyclopedia would be recognized and honored. I believe that, with some effort, this could still be done. My proposal is to, with luck, try to organize the various WikiProjects and other entities of wikipedia to take part in a larger celebrartion of its contributors to take place in January, probably beginning January 15, 2007. I have created yet another new subpage for myself (a weakness of mine, I'm afraid) at User talk:Badbilltucker/Appreciation Week where I would greatly appreciate any indications from the members of this project as to whether and how they might be willing and/or able to assist in recognizing the contributions of our editors. Thank you for your attention. Badbilltucker

created category for Malayali scientists--Kathanar

Good job! I've added it to the categories list on the portal.

On a related note, it is high time we created a few more stub categories. Category:Kerala stubs is becoming very large. We could pool in the suggestions here (examples include {{Kerala-history-stub}} or {{Kerala-politics-stub}}) and later take them to Wikipedia:WikiProject Stub sorting/Proposals for approval.--thunderboltz(Deepu)

I've created a category for Sree Narayana Guru, his influence is a movement unto itself, but has no identifying name, so I've used his name. If anyone knows a name, preferably something identifiable and specific to him, they are welcome to change the category. Thanks!--Kathanar

A Achayan article has been created, could use help in checking over. I'm starting to look for citations, any help in that would be welcomed also--Kathanar

Somebody moved Prem Nazir to Abdul Khader. It should be reversed as Prem Nazir is by far the better known name. Tintin

Article on Dr. Joy Cherian created, former head of the US EEOC, anyone know what he's been up to lately? Just found some past stuff about him. --Kathanar

I have expanded the article to a more credible level. Still needs added info. jojo@nthony 06:45, 10 April 2014 (UTC)

A category made for Keralite americans, can be even of partial descent as long as some part of the family originated from Kerala.--Kathanar

A move has been made to Merge Category:Keralite americans to Category:Indian Americans. I think that as a distinct culture region and ethnicity for centuries, there deserves to be a category citing people(americans) with any connection of origin there. If you wish to put your thoughts go to Here --Kathanar

Article created for a great athelete of Kerala M D Valsamma

sumal

I think you may have to rewrite it in your words because the Ministry of Sports portal, though an Indian govt site, is not in the public domain. Tintin

well I have edited it to reword it and make it look better. See if you can make it better --Agεθ020 (ΔT • ФC)

I too modified it a little. Tintin

The article is undergoing a featured article nomination. So, just give your opinion on it over here [1]. --Agεθ020 (ΔT • ФC)

Technopark, Kerala has been promoted to a Featured Article. Thanks everyone for all the help and support. --Ajaypp (I am here..)

I remember there was a guy, I think his name was Unni Warrier, who is a CEO of a sucessful Silicon Valley Fortune 500 company. Does anyone know who that is, I wanted to do a article on him start doing other malayali businessmen, a area that doesn't get explored often for malayalis.--Kathanar

Wikipedia already has an article on him. See Unni Warrier. Is he the same person you are referring to?--thunderboltz(TALK)

Awesome!,Thanks Deepu, I should of checked, I only just remembered today what his first name was, which I edited into the comment. O.k. , one down, now gotta find some more to go. Thanks again --Kathanar

:-) Good luck!--thunderboltz(TALK)

Category created for Malayali business people--Kathanar

I recently came across this article, which seemed to be on the path to an AFD/speedy-delete [2], and added enough content to establish notability. Can editors more knowledgeable about the subject and with better access to related sources, assess my additions and add further content ? Thanks. Abecedare

the picture on the page is of sree narayana guru. since there is no other pictures of V.T, people may get confused???

Flyingdreams (talk)

A new user has added a lot of information to Malayali. He told me that since he is not that familiar with Wikipedia, there is probably a need for wikification and copyediting. I took a look at the article and I would have go through and edited it and fixed it up myself, except that I'm rather busy at work and my activities on Wikipedia are limited to performing minor edits and such. I thought I'd post this here to alert other Malayalee Wikipedians of this fact. I also propose moving the article from Malayali to Malayalee. The latter seems to be the more common spelling. --vi5in[talk]

I have uploaded a better quality photo of Athirapilly falls. (View from below). http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Image:Athirapilly_falls_summer.jpg May be this one can be used as the title image for the articles Athirappilly_Falls and Athirapilly, where a low quality picture is used now. Sangfroid

The Malayali scientist category is being put up for deletion at [3]. Please participate to let your voice be known. --Kathanar

I have created this article who holds the record for writing the longest novel in Malayalam, Avakaasikal. I wonder if anyone could help expand it.--Agεθ020 (ΔT • ФC)

It had been suggested to make a article on Dr. Kumar Bahuleyan. He is a neurosurgeon from Chemmanakary, Kerala who overcame great odds (came from a poor dalit background). He then turns around and donates 20 million dollars to this village to give back to the people who raised and help him. I think its a worthy piece if someone wants to pursue it. Check out this article [4] which says a little a bit about him, as well as google him.--Kathanar

Comments needed about notability needed there Corpx

Hi,

I was wondering what ever happened to Malayalam fonts since on the Malayalam pages and the Malayalam Wikipedia itself it is filled with a bunch of question marks. I have raised this issue on our WikiProject Dravidian civilizations here. Is there a way to get the Malayalam font back up and working again on Wikipedia? Wiki Raja

Hmm? It looks as good to me as it ever did! Only problem on my computer (or maybe just browser) is that the font looks small. I find the same thing happens with the Bengali font, too. --Kuaichik

Chalachitra Academy is a requested article under our tasks. I created the article for the Chalachitra Academy as Kerala State Chalachitra Academy--Anoopkn (talk)

Please check the article Kolath. Can anyone provide some accuracy of whether to keep this article or not? Earlier, I thought of nominating this to AfD, but still in search of some valuable opinions. Hence I placed expert-need tag. Thank you.--Avinesh Jose T

Yes, the article does not belong on an encyclopedia. There are many other such non-encyclopedic genealogical entries from Kerala on Wikipedia. These need to go as well. In this case, much of the historical stuff given there is widely disputed too.--thunderboltz(TALK)

Another editor created an article on Vadakkanthara. It should probably be cleaned up and expanded. --Eastmain (talk)

I've made an attempt. --Avinesh Jose T

Another editor created an article on Vellimadukunnu without any references. It would be helpful if someone could add at least one reference to the article. --Eastmain (talk)

A bunch of Non-notable articles with no proper references (all related to different casts in Kerala). The details are mentioned by anonymous user in Kolath’s DRV. Another list is available here also. Can anyone comment whether to keep these or nominate group deletion? I think just to mention about different casts Caste system in Kerala is ok, no seperate articles required since no sources available.

--Avinesh Jose T

Agree with you. All those surname pages have to go. Go ahead and afd them.--thunderboltz(TALK)

Hey guys, a user has requested more users with local knowledge (in his words: "I am requesting more authentic comments from Wikiadmins from this part of the world as they have more knowledge about the history here.") to contribute to a discussion regarding the deletion of Pakalomattom Ayrookuzhiyil and Pakalomattom, both of which are basically genealogical ancestries and other non-notable bits of unsourcable information (or, more accurately, information for which reliable sources cannot be given). Please comment on the nomination page with your response to keep or delete and please provide discussion that addresses matters raised on the page. Thanks guys, this should help to resolve things. --rm 'w avu

Me as one of the main contributor to these articles Pakalomattom and Pakalomattom Ayrookuzhiyil welcome your kind inputs to this AFD discussion. Wikipedians who are interested / knowledgable on Indian / Kerala Christian history are very welcome .

Please see Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Pakalomattom Ayrookuzhiyil

Tinucherian (talk)

You can help Kannur Rajan article. Thanks. --Avinesh Jose T

what's karelam(malayalam text) —Preceding unsigned comment added by 121.247.152.226 (talk)

Expanded the article with filmography and additonal references. jojo@nthony 12:22, 8 April 2014 (UTC)

I have added {{WP India}} banner and kerala=yes tag and assessed lots of articles recently See logs . Should you seek any reassessment , Kindly let me know or the assessment dept of WP:INDIA -- TinuCherian (Wanna Talk?) -

Hello folks,

The Philippine Wikipedia Community will be holding its 1st Meet-up in Cebu City (the fourth one in the Philippines) on June 23-24, 2008. This coincides with the first Philippine Open Source Summit, also to be held in Cebu. The Philippine Wikipedia Community is an Implementing Partner of the Open Source Summit. We invite you to join us in this event. If you are in the IT or IT-enabled services industry, this would be a great opportunity to meet people from the 4th best outsourcing city in the world. This is also a good excuse to visit our beautiful beaches :)

If you're interested in joining the Wikipedia meet-up, please join our discussion. You can register for the Open Source Summit here. If you would like some assistance with local accomodations, you may email User:Bentong Isles.

The Philippine Wikipedia Community

WP:PINOY

I have created an article regarding Anna Chandy , the first women judge of India. Can somebody help with more details asap -- TinuCherian (Wanna Talk?) -

I used AWB +Kingbotk/Plugin to add our project banner + kerala=yes in Category:Kerala geography stubs.They got populated on Category:Unassessed-Class_Kerala_articles and not in Category:Unassessed Kerala articles, and hence dont appear on the stats page in WP:KERALA page as unassessed articles..

Anythoughts ? -- TinuCherian (Wanna Talk?) -

Done : Issue was fixed by thunderboltz. Thanks -- TinuCherian (Wanna Talk?) -

I bumped into this article and am not sure if this person is notable enough. Sorry if he is. I can't find anything tangible by google search. Cheers Wiki San Roze †αLҝ

Doesn't ring a bell to me, at least :-/ --Kuaichik (talk)

Feels NON-notable.If so, may be AFD to get opinions ? -- TinuCherian (Wanna Talk?) -

Thanks for the input. I too thought it might not be notable especially after looking at the contributions of the user who created it. Cheers Wiki San Roze †αLҝ

TinucherianBot can automatically tag articles with {{WP India}} Banner as {{WP India|class=|importance=}} to the talk page of articles without the project banner. It can also add the workgroup paramaters like "|kerala=yes|kerala-importance=" etc ,if needed. The currently supported workgroups are Kerala, Maharashtra, Andhra pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Gujarat, Bengal, Goa, Himachal Pradesh , Karnataka , Punjab,cities, Cinema, Literature, Protected Areas of India, History, Politics states, Geography,Maps,Districts and Tamil.

If you need so, you need to provide me with the Categories to run the Bot. Due to some technical issues, the Bot will not run recursively to sub-categories. The requester should kindly verify that there are NO non-related articles in the category.

You may request for the bot run on my talk page... Thanks -- TinuCherian (Wanna Talk?) -

You can see the progress of auto tagging for this project here -- TinuCherian (Wanna Talk?) -

Done : currently there are 1840 unassessed of 3088 articles for the project ( Earlier 117/930) -- TinuCherian (Wanna Talk?) -

You can add the articles that need to be autotagged by the BOT here Wikipedia:WikiProject Kerala/AutoTagging -- TinuCherian (Wanna Talk?) -

A discussion regarding Category:Malayalam literature is now at Wikipedia_talk:WikiProject_India#Categories . Please give your comments -- TinuCherian (Wanna Talk?) -

I have created a few cats and reordered some of the categories. Please feel free to add articles to the relavent articles -- TinuCherian (Wanna Talk?) -

To help this workgroup patrol existing articles for vandalism/recent changes, Ganeshbot has created the Wikipedia:WikiProject Kerala/Articles page. This page will be updated on a regular basis. Please do remind me if I forget. :) It contains articles that were tagged with the India banner and fall under the scope of this workgroup. Please let me know in case of any questions. Thanks, Ganeshk (talk)

User:WolterBot has created a Wikipedia:WikiProject Kerala/Cleanup listing page; it contains the articles that fall under the scope this workgroup and have cleanup tags on them. See this page for more information on this works. Please let me know if you have any questions. Thanks, Ganeshk (talk)

As you may have heard, we at the Wikipedia 1.0 Editorial Team recently made some changes to the assessment scale, including the addition of a new level. The new description is available at WP:ASSESS.

The new C-Class represents articles that are beyond the basic Start-Class, but which need additional references or cleanup to meet the standards for B-Class.

The criteria for B-Class have been tightened up with the addition of a rubric, and are now more in line with the stricter standards already used at some projects.

A-Class article reviews will now need more than one person, as described here.

Each WikiProject should already have a new C-Class category at Category:C-Class_articles. If your project elects not to use the new level, you can simply delete your WikiProject's C-Class category and clarify any amendments on your project's assessment/discussion pages. The bot is already finding and listing C-Class articles.

Please leave a message with us if you have any queries regarding the introduction of the revised scheme. This scheme should allow the team to start producing offline selections for your project and the wider community within the next year. Thanks for using the Wikipedia 1.0 scheme! For the 1.0 Editorial Team, §hepBot (Disable)

Wikipedia 0.7 is a collection of English Wikipedia articles due to be released on DVD, and available for free download, later this year. The Wikipedia:Version 1.0 Editorial Team has made an automated selection of articles for Version 0.7.

We would like to ask you to review the articles selected from this project. These were chosen from the articles with this project's talk page tag, based on the rated importance and quality. If there are any specific articles that should be removed, please let us know at Wikipedia talk:Version 0.7. You can also nominate additional articles for release, following the procedure at Wikipedia:Release Version Nominations.

A list of selected articles with cleanup tags, sorted by project, is available. The list is automatically updated each hour when it is loaded. Please try to fix any urgent problems in the selected articles. A team of copyeditors has agreed to help with copyediting requests, although you should try to fix simple issues on your own if possible.

We would also appreciate your help in identifying the version of each article that you think we should use, to help avoid vandalism or POV issues. These versions can be recorded at this project's subpage of User:SelectionBot/0.7. We are planning to release the selection for the holiday season, so we ask you to select the revisions before October 20. At that time, we will use an automatic process to identify which version of each article to release, if no version has been manually selected. Thanks! For the Wikipedia 1.0 Editorial team, SelectionBot

In this article about the town Konni (which is a place of tourist interest), the name of the state Kerala has been mis-spelt as Kerela.

Konni, Kerala redirects to Konni (India). Why not merge the article with Konni (India) since that makes broader sense? Please advise.

ChrysalSnowlax (talk)

Admins please check this issue. ChrysalSnowlax (talk)

I have a problem with the presentation of the cities in the infobox. Some people think, that it would be not necessary to keep the information i put in (e. g. Thrissur) to make clear, which term is the anglicised form. I would like to see your opinions on the issue. My preference is clear: Ideally, the form in Thrissur should be the standard for Kerala related articles, because readers from outside could be confused easily by the two names. --Stopthenonsense (talk)

I have nominated Kerala for a featured article review here. Please join the discussion on whether this article meets featured article criteria. Articles are typically reviewed for two weeks. If substantial concerns are not addressed during the review period, the article will be moved to the Featured Article Removal Candidates list for a further period, where editors may declare "Keep" or "Remove" the article's featured status. The instructions for the review process are here. --Stopthenonsense (talk)

Hi! You might be interested in the discussion at Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/S Varghese. Thank you. Qwfp (talk) (Using {{Please see}})

I added some references to Integrated Rural Technology Centre. Perhaps someone else could further expand the article. -- Eastmain (talk)

I have written an article about nalacharitham, kathakali attakkatha. This is my first attempt, would be great if the editors can review and give me feedback. I am planning to contribute mostly in this area. The article is in my userpage. Profpcm (talk)

I have been working with a web site www.thekeralatemples.com, which described more than 1500 temples in kerala. Its my humble attempt to identify almost all temples in kerala and its history, rituals, offerings, routes and even unbelievable offerings. i request wikipedia editors/volunteers to review my web site link (www.thekeralatemples.com) and add in external link section of the article "List of Hindu Temples in Kerala" if found suitable, so that everyone could information about kerala temples.

(Note: This project is for building up an area to share information about temples in Kerala. This site can be treated as a knowledge sharing area of kerala temples, rather than a travel guide portal. Since both sounds similar, I am very clear on my intention, which is nothing but to cherish our valuable temple culture in Kerala. This project does not deal with any sort of business by tour packages or travel guiding.) —Preceding unsigned comment added by Stnnetindia (talk • contribs)

Unfortunately, I dont think your site qualifies as a reliable source so please do not add it to articles. Corpx (talk)

hi, corpx, may i know the reason behind the disqualification? problem with the reliability of source or violation of external link guideliness. kindly clarify so that i can improve my project accordingly. —Preceding unsigned comment added by Stnnetindia (talk • contribs)

See Wikipedia:RS#Scholarship. I dont think your site would qualify as a "Academic and peer-reviewed publication" or anything similar. Corpx (talk)

Dear Sir

Kindly permit me to note a small change in the Kerala's participation for freedom struggle. Kerala was no way behind to fight against British empire, it was Pazassi Raja who first revolted against the British,much prior to Mangal Pandey.

Secondly Kunjali Marakar fought against Portugese and British. I however, appreciate the article provides good academic knowledge to young children.

HARIHARAN T.R. —Preceding unsigned comment added by 120.60.128.102 (talk)

Your contributions are most welcome. You may decide to create an account in wiki for the contributions. However please remember to provide valid references for your contributions. You can use this page: Wikipedia:WikiProject Kerala/Sand box, for experimenting your edits before you decide to post it in the article. Cheers, -- Rajith Mohan (Talk to me..)

This message is being sent to each WikiProject that participates in the WP 1.0 assessment system. On Saturday, January 23, 2010, the WP 1.0 bot will be upgraded. Your project does not need to take any action, but the appearance of your project's summary table will change. The upgrade will make many new, optional features available to all WikiProjects. Additional information is available at the WP 1.0 project homepage. — Carl (CBM · talk)

The Coconut page has spent most of its history written in Indian English (with spellings like flavour), because of its significance in India and other countries in the Commonwealth. Recently, one American editor has unilaterally changed it to American (flavor), on the grounds that the first early stub versions of the article were in American, and that the coconut is insignificant in India compared to the importance of the USA (where coconuts aren't grown much). If you wish to voice an opinion, please add your commets to the discussion at Talk:Coconut in the Language section at the end of the page. Thank you! 217.206.228.30 (talk)

For more information see Wikipedia:Meetup/Kerala--naveenpf (talk)

User:DASHBot/Wikiprojects provides a list, updated daily, of unreferenced living people articles (BLPs) related to your project. There has been a lot of discussion recently about deleting these unreferenced articles, so it is important that these articles are referenced.

The unreferenced articles related to your project can be found at >>>Wikipedia:WikiProject Kerala/Archive 3/Unreferenced BLPs<<<

If you do not want this wikiproject to participate, please add your project name to this list.

Thank you.

Update: Wikipedia:WikiProject Kerala/Archive 3/Unreferenced BLPs has been created. This list, which is updated by User:DASHBot/Wikiprojects daily, will allow your wikiproject to quickly identify unreferenced living person articles.

There maybe no or few articles on this new Unreferenced BLPs page. To increase the overall number of articles in your project with another bot, you can sign up for User:Xenobot_Mk_V#Instructions.

If you have any questions or concerns, visit User talk:DASHBot/Wikiprojects. Okip

Article about Abdul Nasser Madani is there...and article about A. R. Raja Raja Varma is en route -[[:

C T Mathews article is up for deletion - in my view soley for want of references as his notability seems clear. Can anyone help with any paper references as there do not seem to be many on the internet that I can find? Thanks in advance (Msrasnw (talk) )PS the Afd is here Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/C. T. Mathew

Version 0.8 is a collection of Wikipedia articles selected by the Wikipedia 1.0 team for offline release on USB key, DVD and mobile phone. Articles were selected based on their assessed importance and quality, then article versions (revisionIDs) were chosen for trustworthiness (freedom from vandalism) using an adaptation of the WikiTrust algorithm.

We would like to ask you to review the Kerala articles and revisionIDs we have chosen. Selected articles are marked with a diamond symbol (♦) to the right of each article, and this symbol links to the selected version of each article. If you believe we have included or excluded articles inappropriately, please contact us at Wikipedia talk:Version 0.8 with the details. You may wish to look at your WikiProject's articles with cleanup tags and try to improve any that need work; if you do, please give us the new revisionID at Wikipedia talk:Version 0.8. We would like to complete this consultation period by midnight UTC on Monday, October 11th.

We have greatly streamlined the process since the Version 0.7 release, so we aim to have the collection ready for distribution by the end of October, 2010. As a result, we are planning to distribute the collection much more widely, while continuing to work with groups such as One Laptop per Child and Wikipedia for Schools to extend the reach of Wikipedia worldwide. Please help us, with your WikiProject's feedback!

For the Wikipedia 1.0 editorial team, SelectionBot

I have nominated Adi Shankara for a featured article review here. Please join the discussion on whether this article meets featured article criteria. Articles are typically reviewed for two weeks. If substantial concerns are not addressed during the review period, the article will be moved to the Featured Article Removal Candidates list for a further period, where editors may declare "Keep" or "Delist" the article's featured status. The instructions for the review process are here. YellowMonkey (new photo poll)

In my opinion, a rewrite and cleanup is needed for the article about Yesudas, one of the most prominent/famous person from Kerala.

Things I noticed in the current version

Lots of grammatical errors.

Long sentences with unnecessary details.

Facts repeated in multiple sections.

Some sentences sounds like praise rather than fact.

Lack of relevant details.

Overall a rewrite is needed. Sangfroid (talk)

I have nominated Technopark, Kerala for a featured article review here. Please join the discussion on whether this article meets featured article criteria. Articles are typically reviewed for two weeks. If substantial concerns are not addressed during the review period, the article will be moved to the Featured Article Removal Candidates list for a further period, where editors may declare "Keep" or "Delist" the article's featured status. The instructions for the review process are here. YellowMonkey (new photo poll)

I have created together with Smallman12q a toolserver tool that shows a weekly-updated list of cleanup categories for WikiProjects, that can be used as a replacement for WolterBot and this WikiProject is among those that are already included (because it is a member of Category:WolterBot cleanup listing subscriptions). See the tool's wiki page, this project's listing in one big table or by categories and the index of WikiProjects. Svick (talk)

I've tried and failed to find any sources verifying the existence of Kalarickal manikanda swami temple in Kottayam District, if anyone here can do so that would be appreciated. Fences&Windows

Anyone here with a little time to spare, please take a look at Mohanlal. I have made significant changes to the article. I have also listed it for peer review at Wikiproject India. Also, it would be nice if we can add more images to the article and find reliable sources for material before 2000's.

Shekure (talk)

Please provide your feedback on the aforementioned AfD as its getting highly controversial by days. - Wikiglobaleditor (talk)

This NYT article mentions "Dabba Kali" - A children's game in Kerala, India. It says that there are few sources about it, but many people play it: http://www.nytimes.com/2011/08/08/business/media/a-push-to-redefine-knowledge-at-wikipedia.html?_r=1&ref=noamcohen

So, would anyone have any idea on what sources out there talk about it? WhisperToMe (talk)

Is it this article ?gollikali --Fotokannan (talk) 12:02, 12 August 2011 (UTC) http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:PeopleAreKnowledge_Dabba-Kali_Interview1.ogg?uselang=ml — Preceding unsigned comment added by Vijayakumarblathur (talk • contribs)

The correct article in ml wikipedia is Dabba_kali. This article is created in ml wikipedia using the oral citations. The effort was part of Research:Oral_Citations Project.--Rameshng (talk)

Hi friends, I have created a page about a great Motivational Speaker Dr T P Sasikumar from Kerala. Hence I need your help in the form of support for my article. Please do approve it under WikiProject Kerala. U could google "Dr T P Sasikumar" and can find out about him. Hope that u would be helping me. Thanks, Anusha — Preceding unsigned comment added by 121.242.177.19 (talk)

Can someone please take a look at the article Nedumpally. 218.248.72.195 (talk · contribs) -- same as Ashleypt (talk · contribs) -- has added a huge chunk of text about Indus Valley Civilization, Aryans, Dravidians etc. in the article. This text has no direct connection to the topic of the article. He also keeps removing {{citation needed}} tags for claims like "one of the earliest and largest families" and "have reached Kerala from North India after 1000 BC". Many of the references cited are from Wikipedia pages or unreliable sources (e.g. geocities/angelfire pages).

I've express my concerns about the article at Talk:Nedumpally#Irrelevant_information. The anon user keeps reverting my edits without addressing any of these concerns (here's the last revert).

Since I was involved in editing the content, I don't want to start an edit war or block the user. It'd be nice if someone else can mediate. utcursch | talk

Why on the earth there isn't any articles about current events in Kerala on en-wikipedia? Articles about events happened after 1970 are very scare. — Preceding unsigned comment added by 115.117.251.108 (talk)

Tamil Wiki Media Contest

Greetings from the Tamil Wiki Community,

We are organising a Media Contest for images/videos/audios related to Tamil, Tamils and Tamil Nadu.

Prize Money: Total prize money for the contest is 850 US$. First prize is 200 US $ and there are a total of 9 prizes including three continuous contribution prizes. Certificates will be awarded to prize winners

Upload: Files have to be uploaded to Wikimedia commons through the Contest portal using a customised version of the commons upload wizard. Or if you choose to upload directly to commons, the category "TamilWiki Media Contest" has to be added to the files.

Dates : Nov 15, 2011 - Feb 29, 2012

Contest portal: Portal

Themes : Anything related to Tamil and Tamils (more detailed rules here)

All files should be uploaders' own work. Copyright expired and PD/CC images of others are not eligible.

We invite you all to participate in the contest. Please spread the word among your friends and share our Facebook page:

--Sodabottle (talk)

The Tag & Assess Drive 2012 has been devised for pending backlog in WP India to achieve

Quality assessments for unassessed WP India articles.

Adding importance missed during previous assessment.

Bringing more articles into the scope of the project and subject them to assessment.

So far 8706 assessments (including quality and importance) have been performed in a span of 10 days. The drive is still open and we encourage participants from WP Kerala to enroll themselves. WP Kerala is one of the daughter projects having huge assessement backlog. The participation would be very much appreciated - thanks in advance.

AshLin (talk) and ssriram_mt (talk).

Hello fellow editors, I have started a deletion discussion on Santhosh Pandit at Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Santhosh Pandit (4th nomination). Your participation will be appreciated. Thanks. Austria156 (talk)

We need help with the article Jayaram Padikkal - which is currently nominated for deletion but I am hopeful that it will be kept. The article does not have any biographical information about the subject - date and place of birth, date and place of death, etc. Any source would probably be in Malayalam since he was from Kerala. Can someone who knows Malayalam look for this information, and add it to the article if found? Thanks. (Request was also posted at WP:India) --MelanieN (talk)

Followup: The AfD discussion has been closed and the article was kept, but it still lacks basic biographical information. --MelanieN (talk)

Hello All!

The article St. Johns Orthodox Church, Kadammanitta is under AfD and i wanted to find our population of this village Kadammanitta. But i am not able to figure out in which taluka of Pathanamthitta district does it belong. Could anyone help? §§AnimeshKulkarni (talk)

The article you mentioned (under AFD) lacks any credible source and I think its better to be deleted. Anyway as per this source it is in Kozhencherry Taluk. AshLey Msg

Sources i have supplied and recognised by WP:RSN [[5]] but its been rejected by other admins. This is one of many reliable sources supplied.

Hello there! As you may already know, most WikiProjects here on Wikipedia struggle to stay active after they've been founded. I believe there is a lot of potential for WikiProjects to facilitate collaboration across subject areas, so I have submitted a grant proposal with the Wikimedia Foundation for the "WikiProject X" project. WikiProject X will study what makes WikiProjects succeed in retaining editors and then design a prototype WikiProject system that will recruit contributors to WikiProjects and help them run effectively. Please review the proposal here and leave feedback. If you have any questions, you can ask on the proposal page or leave a message on my talk page. Thank you for your time! (Also, sorry about the posting mistake earlier. If someone already moved my message to the talk page, feel free to remove this posting.) Harej (talk)

This is a notice about Category:Kerala articles needing expert attention, which might be of interest to your WikiProject. It will take a while before the category is populated. Iceblock (talk)

Hello everyone!

You may have received a message from me earlier asking you to comment on my WikiProject X proposal. The good news is that WikiProject X is now live! In our first phase, we are focusing on research. At this time, we are looking for people to share their experiences with WikiProjects: good, bad, or neutral. We are also looking for WikiProjects that may be interested in trying out new tools and layouts that will make participating easier and projects easier to maintain. If you or your WikiProject are interested, check us out! Note that this is an opt-in program; no WikiProject will be required to change anything against its wishes. Please let me know if you have any questions. Thank you!

Note: To receive additional notifications about WikiProject X on this talk page, please add this page to Wikipedia:WikiProject X/Newsletter. Otherwise, this will be the last notification sent about WikiProject X.

Harej (talk)

The Thiyya community are an indigenous population of the Malabar region of Kerala. They are the influential Hindu community of prominence in north Malabar, being financially sound and greater in numerical strength. Considered to be highly educated and advanced in every walk of life they were regarded as a forward caste during the British period when Malabar was part of Madras province. As a community they are considered to be emotionally strong with deeper social values thus reacting sharply to injustice and social bigotry.

What is the abbreviation used for dates in the Malayalam calendar? In the article Pandalam dynasty, I see that CE is being used, such as 995 CE (1820 AD), where in there is a difference of 825 years against the Gregorian calendar. CE is an abbreviation to be used for Common Era, which is numerically the same as AD. The use of CE for the Kollam Era makes the ENTIRE article confusing! Jay (talk)

The reason I am contacting you is because there are one or more portals that fall under this subject, and the Portals WikiProject is currently undertaking a major drive to automate portals that may affect them.

Portals are being redesigned.

The new design features are being applied to existing portals.

At present, we are gearing up for a maintenance pass of portals in which the introduction section will be upgraded to no longer need a subpage. In place of static copied and pasted excerpts will be self-updating excerpts displayed through selective transclusion, using the template {{Transclude lead excerpt}}.

The discussion about this can be found here.

Maintainers of specific portals are encouraged to sign up as project members here, noting the portals they maintain, so that those portals are skipped by the maintenance pass. Currently, we are interested in upgrading neglected and abandoned portals. There will be opportunity for maintained portals to opt-in later, or the portal maintainers can handle upgrading (the portals they maintain) personally at any time.

Background

On April 8th, 2018, an RfC ("Request for comment") proposal was made to eliminate all portals and the portal namespace. On April 17th, the Portals WikiProject was rebooted to handle the revitalization of the portal system. On May 12th, the RfC was closed with the result to keep portals, by a margin of about 2 to 1 in favor of keeping portals.

There's an article in the current edition of the Signpost interviewing project members about the RfC and the Portals WikiProject.

Since the reboot, the Portals WikiProject has been busy building tools and components to upgrade portals.

So far, 84 editors have joined.

If you would like to keep abreast of what is happening with portals, see the newsletter archive.

If you have any questions about what is happening with portals or the Portals WikiProject, please post them on the WikiProject's talk page.

Thank you. — The Transhumanist

A discussion is taking place as to whether Portal:Malayalam cinema is suitable for inclusion in Wikipedia according to Wikipedia's policies and guidelines or whether it should be deleted.

The page will be discussed at Wikipedia:Miscellany for deletion/Portal:Malayalam cinema until a consensus is reached, and anyone is welcome to contribute to the discussion. The nomination will explain the policies and guidelines which are of concern. The discussion focuses on high-quality evidence and our policies and guidelines.

Users may edit the page during the discussion, including to improve the page to address concerns raised in the discussion. However, do not remove the deletion notice from the top of the page. North America1000
